bible.derived: Masoretic Text, Nestle-Aland Greek New Testament.

translations.name: Revised Standard Version
translations.description: The Revised Standard Version (RSV) is a revision of the American Standard Version (ASV) authorized in 1952 by the National Council of Churches. With its intent to \\\"preserve all that is best in the English Bible as it has been known and used through the centuries\\\" and \\\"to put the message of the Bible in simple, enduring words that are worthy to stand in the great Tyndale-King James tradition.” the RSV posed the first serious challenge to the popularity of the King James Version (KJV).
